reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow that's my reading dedicated to one author!
reviews.reviewText: Totally my favourite genre!!!! And I had this read so fast!!!! I'm off on a journey with one author for a little while!K. A. Riley - whoever you are - You are one of the best authors I have ever read .... And I'm looking forward to the journey with you ☺️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love this author and the stories she writes. I honestly would have given this book the full 5 stars but there were several spelling errors throughout the whole book. A few times I had to think about what the word was based on context clues. Other than that the book was amazing!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Book! #1 in a series.
reviews.reviewText: I read this in 3 days. I literally couldn’t put it down other than when I absolutely had to. The author is fantastic! This is book #1 in a series. All of the books have an ending and you can stop where you wish. I know that is true for this book. I could have stopped here if I wanted to as it has a very tidy ending if you know what I mean. I ordered the second book when I was 1/3 into this one and yay it comes just as this book has ended. I plan on reading all of the books by this amazing author.I think that I would have loved this book at any age but it is at this point in my life that I am able to understand all the ‘nuances’.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to like this but there are so many typos & such poor editing that I couldn't enjoy it. Interesting idea though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars K. A. Riley uses Edgar A. Poe's Philosophy of Composition!
reviews.reviewText: I will be going on a rant with two significant authors. Firstly, Edgar Allan Poe wrote "Philosophy of Composition." He states explicitly that in order for a story to be attention-grabbing, you need to have the main point of the story be in sight of the reader at all times. K. A. Riley never stops talking about "recruitment" and "recruitment day," which gave me a real reason to read it, unlike other books that ramble on about events that really don't matter.The story definitely picks up the pace a few chapters in, but I promise you, as a reader who has never really gotten into reading...This is different. There are slight bits of romance here and there, tons of suspense everywhere, adrenaline-pumping action all throughout the story, and lots of character development spread throughout the story. All those things I listed are perfectly divided throughout the story, making for a superior way of story-telling.I will say, though, because the series is a set of 4 trilogies or 12 books in the entire series, this book does end at a climax. It only just started...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Totally surprised by the twist! Did not see it coming! Best storyline in a long time! I am so looking forward to the next book!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nothing original- nothing bad
reviews.reviewText: I’m being very generous with my review of a 4/5 star. It has same kind of vibe/idea as the divergent series, which nowadays it feels like every book is like another. Characters are various but the main one, Kress, becomes whiney and romantically pathetic a quarter of the way in. All of the seventeen year olds is whisked away on Nov 1 every year to be trained to fight the Eastern Order who they’re currently in war with. During training they find their speciality. K.A. Riley did well with the challenges (a bit of escape room vibe to some) and knows when to end the story/chapter. I just find this series so far to be too unoriginal. New characters. new author. same story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprising and Interesting
reviews.reviewText: I’m already SO excited to get to the second book in this series!! This one starts out with a lot of characters and some really interesting mysteries, and then the entire book is one crazy situation after another. At the end, hang onto ur brain, cuz it’s gonna get blown! There is a pretty good twist! I would say it’s predictable - but only in that you know there’s gotta be something “hinky” going on - but it’s not something you’re gonna see coming! She definitely foreshadows the twist, but I was pleasantly surprised by what it ends up being!! K A Riley has a dang good start here, and I am ITCHING to get to the second book!! Well written characters, an incredibly thought-out plot line with amazing potential to be a hang-on-to-your-shorts type of series reminiscent of The Hunger Games and the Divergent series, but with a fresh coat of paint!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 31, 2022
reviews.reviewText: An excellent read from start to finish. If you are a Hunger Games fan you will love this book. Couldn’t put it down.

The author made every character in this book so likable and easy to relate to, including the bad guys. It had good depth, showing how every person in the "family" contributed, from Manthy's supernatural tech powers, to Card's fierce loyalty. K. A. made the story fast paced and filled with twists every now and then, with a small bit of romance between Brohn and Kress. The characters suffered many losses, SPOILER ALERT, but the one that hit me most was the loss of Karmine because I thought he and Kella would well end up together. I really liked how even though they were all different from each other, they stood up and never gave the blame to someone else, instead taking the blame together, which I really liked in how they were a "family". This book keeps you turning every page so you must must read it.

Wowee this was great. I love a good dystopian story. The characters in this series are great, the story is very intriguing and I didn't see the twist coming at all.I'll be moving onto book two straight away!!

A lot of world and story building, I would give it like 3.5 stars because it’s a slower start and progression but the end of the book just blows up and you know the second book is gonna be great. I liked the writing, the flow overall, it’s an easy to follow read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Divergent vibes, good but not sure I’ll read the rest of the series. Not a lot of romance or spice
